column4: Hello, could anyone lead me in a wireless issue with a laptop, please?
Hi, could anyone...?
Noone for help?
Is there anyone that knows about wireless issues in Ubuntu 7.10, please?
maybe I can help you (at least try to)
it should be installed by default in 7.10
it is called nm-applet
But it doesn't appears..!
please try to start it with Alt+F2 (you can also check if nm-applet is running with the command 'ps xa' in the console)
is 'roaming mode' enabled on your network card
afaik network manager manages only cards dat have roaming enabled
OK, but if most of the times it turns its behavour to roaming mode, despite it isn't configured to do that..., the nm-applet in the systray doesnt exist
added. System notifies me that it's necessary rebooting it... After that, do you mean a kill over de the ps number, that's right?
another thing is that it seems that there is nothing called nm-applet in the package repositories... am I right?
Do other applications (like pidgin) appear in the system tray? i think the packet is called 'network-manager' and network-manager-gnome
Pidgin???? No! Right click over the systray... Network monitor, notes, and so on..
I have installe EVERYTHING called networkmanager*, I checked it several times...
try to add something called 'notification area' to another panel. then kill and restart nm-applet
strange that it wants to reboot. if you want to restart the network manager you can do this with killall nm-applet and then start it againt
I'm goint to reboot, see you..
are you still there?
